sen.e: He prepared Buddhist gaatha (verses) and made venerations and, expressed a desire to behold the building up of Buddhism in various countries.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: その仏国土より優れた点を選び取り、発願（ほつがん）し、五劫の間思惟して行を選び取った。
sen.e: From Buddhist countries he selected the very best of aspects, prayed and, pondered for a long time over which course to take.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 願と行を選び取った法蔵菩薩は、師に向かい48の願（四十八願）を述べた。
sen.e: Hozo bosatsu, who has made vows and achieved his will, expressed his forty-eight vows to his mentor.

sen.j: 続けてこの願の目的を述べ重ねて誓った（「重誓偈（三誓偈）」）。
sen.e: Then he expressed the purpose of the vows and again swore to accomplish them.

sen.j: そして兆戴永劫にわたり修行し、願が成就し、無量寿仏（阿弥陀仏）と成り、その仏国土の名が「極楽」であると説かれる。
sen.e: He preached that he had performed ascetic practices for a very long period, completed his vows, became Buddha of Immesurable Life (Amida Buddha). The name of the Buddha-Land was 'the Pure Land.'
sen.cmt: 兆戴永劫の定訳を見つけられませんでした。

sen.j: 願が成就してから十劫が経っていて、阿弥陀仏の徳とその国土である「極楽」の様子が説かれる。
sen.e: Ten kalpa passed after the completion of his vows. The virtue of Amida Buddha and the Buddha Land, "the Pure Land" are also described.

sen.j: 極楽浄土に生まれたいと願う者は皆、仏になることが約束され、阿弥陀仏の名号を聞信し喜び、心から念ずれば往生が定まると説かれる。
sen.e: Shaka preaches that those who want to be born in the Pure Land are surely to become Buddha. If they enjoy listeninng to the name of Amida Buddha and pray cordially, they will surely achieve their passing away into the Pure Land.
sen.cmt: 上巻の時制は、釈尊の経験を表すため、過去形を使いましたが、下巻では歴史家的現在時制にしております。

sen.j: その者たちは、上輩・中輩・下輩に分けられ、それぞれの往生の方法が説かれる。
sen.e: They are divided into top, second, or third class of Buddhists and their respective way of birth in the Pure Land is preached.

sen.j: 修行もやり遂げられない、善行も戎も守りきれない下輩の者は、たとえわずかな回数でも、一心に念ずれば往生がさだまると説かれる。
sen.e: The third class of them cannot complete ascetic practice, conduct good deed, or observe rules. However, their birth the Pure Land will be decided only if they devotedly pray for it even a few times.

sen.e: Shakyamuni advises them to read Gemon ('Tohoge sutra (verses on going to pay reverence to Amida)'), listen to the teachings, respect Amida Buddha and to be born in the Pure Land.

sen.j: 次に釈尊は弥勒菩薩に対して、煩悩のある世界（穢土）に生きる衆生の苦しみの理由を、三毒・五悪（殺生〈せつしよう〉・偸盗〈ちゆうとう〉・邪淫〈じやいん〉・妄語〈もうご〉・飲酒〈おんじゆ〉）によると示し、誡める。
sen.e: Next, Shakyamuni shows Maitreyathe the reasons of pains of creatures who live in the world with earthly desires (Edo, this impure world) and preached against them: three banes, five evils, such as killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying and drinking.
sen.cmt: 「三毒」は定訳をみつけられませんでした。
sen.e: Next, Shakyamuni shows Maitreyathe the reasons for the pains of creatures who live in the world of earthly desires (Edo, this impure world) and preaches against them: three banes, five evils, such as killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying and drinking.

sen.j: 続けて弥勒菩薩に、そのままではその苦しみから逃れられない事を説き、「極楽」に往生する事が苦しみから逃れる方法であると説かれる。

sen.j: 流通分には、無上功徳の名号を受持せよとすすめ、時が流れ一切の法が滅しても、この経（『無量寿経』）だけは留めおいて人々を救いつづけると説かれる。
sen.e: In the Epilogue, he tells that they should keep chanting the name of the supreme efficacy. Even when all the other laws have disappeared with the lapse of time, only this sutra (Muryoju-kyo Sutra) is sure to remain and keep working for the salvation of people.
